posts.name: Angie's Restaurant
posts.note: Angie's Restaurant serves Southern breakfast and lunch classics which are served at this charming eatery with an easygoing vibe. If you like biscuits, you should get them with your breakfast.

posts.name: Apple City BBQ
posts.note: Apple City BBQ is dedicated to serving authentic pit cooked BBQ smoked slowly over apple and hickory wood. They smoke whole hogs along with being family owned and operated.

posts.name: Bar-B-Q King
posts.note: Bar-B-Q King is a family-run drive-in spot serving BBQ, fried chicken in sauce, po' boys, and more curbside since 1959.

posts.name: Beasley's Chicken and Honey
posts.note: Beasley's Chicken and Honey serves updated versions of fried chicken and waffles and other Southern classics in a modern setting.

posts.name: Benchwarmers Bagels
posts.note: From the Benchwarmers Bagels website, 'In that way, Benchwarmers is not a bagel shop that serves coffee or a coffee shop that serves bagels, because the two go hand-in-hand. Benchwarmers is a collaboration between Josh Bellamy and Sam Kirkpatrick of ​Boulted Bread​ and Andrew Cash of ​Jubala Coffee​. Their sandwiches are possibly the best expression of that collective identity. The short menu is bold and creative, but with common-sense offerings that feel friendly and familiar.'

posts.name: Beyú Caffè
posts.note: Beyú Caffè is an upbeat, bohemian hangout offering coffee, all-day American fare, a full bar, live jazz, and free WiFi. The restaurant’s distinguishing feature is its business model, as a brunch spot by day and jazz club by night; inside, musicians rub arms with young professionals working up the street. Its menu features classic Southern comfort food alongside vegan sandwiches.

posts.name: Brewery Bhavana
posts.note: Brewery Bhavana is a maker-inspired hub for craft beer, dim sum, books, and lowers in a stylish space.

posts.name: Brook's Sandwich House
posts.note: Brook's Sandwich House is a tiny roadside stop with a walk-up window serving burgers, chili, and simple sandwiches for 40+ years. You need to order the cheese burger all the way with chili.

posts.name: Buxton Hall Barbecue
posts.note: Buxton Hall Barbecue serves whole-hog East Carolina BBQ, Southern sides, and cocktails on tap that meet in a soaring industrial space.

posts.name: Cast Iron Kitchen
posts.note: Cast Iron Kitchen serves North Carolina Based Southern Cuisine, seasonal and locally driven menu for brunch and breakfast is served all day. They have crafted cocktails and the boat or beach picnic packages. You should order the Not Your Momma’s Meatloaf sandwich or the shrimp and grits or chicken and waffles.

posts.name: The Copper Penny
posts.note: The Copper Penny is an energetic saloon with nightly food and drink specials plus lots of microbrews on tap and in bottles. From their website, 'Located in historic downtown Wilmington, the Copper Penny offers an eclectic mix of appetizers, salads, and sandwiches along with an extensive selection of mixed drinks and beers.' You should order the Hot Roast Pork Sandwich that has sliced pork tenderloin, sautéed spinach, provolone cheese, fried onions, garlic aioli, served with a side of Au Jus, or the 109 Chestnut Chicken which has thinly sliced chicken topped w/ provolone, sautéed mushrooms, caramelized onions, and chipotle mayo, or their Homemade Beer-Battered Onion Rings.

posts.name: Crook's Corner
posts.note: Crook's Corner is where local artwork adorns this famed cafe serving Southern staples from shrimp and grits to cocktails. Crook’s is known best for its “sumptuous take on Southern comfort food” (Garden and Gun). The James Beard Foundation named Crook’s Corner an “America’s Classics” a meaning by their definition that Crook’s has “timeless appeal, beloved for quality of food that reflects the character of their community.”

posts.name: Diamond Restaurant
posts.note: Diamond Restaurant is a hipster-friendly Greek diner serves a vast comfort-food menu with Greek, Italian and Southern accents. You need to order the big block burger with pimento cheese.

posts.name: Duke's Grill
posts.note: Duke's Grill has been around since 1951 in the Five Points area of Monroe before moving to its current location. From what I have heard you need to get chili, slaw, and onions.

posts.name: Fork N’ Cork
posts.note: Fork N’ Cork serves gourmet burgers, sandwiches, and appetizers are on the menu at this quaint, brick-walled bar with TVs. You should order the duck wings or their burgers or the patty melt or the Wellington bites that have port wine cherry sauce.

posts.name: Heirloom Brewshop - Coffee, Tea, Sake
posts.note: Heirloom Brewshop - Coffee, Tea, Sake is a modern outpost featuring espresso drinks, loose-leaf teas, and sake cocktails in a bright, sleek venue. From their website, 'The pursuit of harmony among differences, the union of our various cultures and offerings, and the belief that hospitality and the passionate dedication to crafting genuinely inspired food and beverage can uplift the communities around us. This is the fabric of Heirloom that we are unabashedly unapologetic for. And we’re looking for like-minded members, passionate about coffee, tea, sake, and food to join our family.'

posts.name: Heist Brewery
posts.note: Heist Brewery is an inventive pub fare, craft beers produced on-site and served in an industrial setting with a patio. Order the burger burger burger which is a tri-blend of beef sliders with goat cheese or the duck confit flatbread with pickled red onions.

posts.name: JJ's Red Hots
posts.note: JJ's Red Hots is a spacious retro-style counter serve focused on classic hot dogs and sausages with diverse toppings.

posts.name: Krazy Fish
posts.note: Krazy Fish is an eclectic seafood restaurant and tiki bar with quirky decor along with front and back patio seating. Krazy Fish features distinct dishes inspired by friends and family from all over the world. Their menu ranges from traditional curry dishes to a variety of tasty tacos for everyone to enjoy. When there you need to order the Gumbo or the seafood Diablo over rice.

posts.name: M Tempura
posts.note: From the M Tempura website, 'Our vision for M Tempura is to intensify the traditional tempura omakase-style experience. We take exotic and seasonal high-quality ingredients and elevate them with delicate frying technique. Our menu will feature select seafood and seasonal vegetables, as well as rich meats like Iberico pork from Spain. We hope to bring you a diverse and unique experience, one bite at a time.'

posts.name: Mert’s Heart and Soul
posts.note: Mert’s Heart and Soul is a husband-and-wife-run spot for Southern soul food, including Lowcountry dishes, in a colorful setting. You need to order Merts soul rolls along with shrimp and grits.

posts.name: Midtown Grille
posts.note: Midtown Grille is an intimate New American eatery offering a seasonal menu, sizable wine list, and hand-crafted cocktails. If you’re there for brunch you should get the lamb sausage hash.

posts.name: Pam's Farmhouse Restaurant
posts.note: Pam's Farmhouse Restaurant is a down-to-earth eatery dishing up Southern-style comfort food in an unassuming atmosphere. From USA Today 10 Best website, 'If you need to get going early, Pam's starts serving a delicious Southern breakfast at 6 AM. Dig into a plate of pancakes, drizzled with syrup, or a platter of bacon and eggs. Prepared with primarily local ingredients, from produce to meats, the fare is flavorful and fresh. Midday grub consists of succulent fried chicken, roast beef, okra, corn, collard greens, potatoes and gravy and more.'

posts.name: Pinky’s Westside Grill
posts.note: Pinky’s Westside Grill is a local American chain serving sandwiches, hot dogs, tacos, and cocktails in a casual, offbeat space. It's a converted auto repair shop, this casual restaurant that serves towering burgers, snappy dogs, and not-too-healthy salads topped with popcorn chicken and fried buffalo shrimp. NOTE: They have multiple locations.

posts.name: Poole's
posts.note: Poole's is a circa-1945 diner with seasonal comfort food, cocktails, and house desserts in a retro-chic setting.

posts.name: Sister Liu’s Kitchen
posts.note: Sister Liu’s Kitchen serves unforgettable dumplings, for carryout only. From their website, 'Homestyle Northeastern Chinese Food made by hand with family recipes in Durham, NC and delivered with love to the Research Triangle Park Community. Sister Liu's Kitchen is a cornerstone in the Durham community and has been recognized for its outstanding Chinese cuisine, excellent service, and friendly staff. Our Chinese restaurant is known for its modern interpretation of classic dishes and its insistence on only using high-quality fresh ingredients.'

posts.name: Something Fishy Seafood
posts.note: Something Fishy Seafood is a down-home seafood shack dishing up generous servings of clams, shrimp, and more in old-school digs. You need to order the seafood platter which has seven types of fried seafood items which probably could feed two people or more.

posts.name: South 21 Drive In
posts.note: South 21 Drive In is an old, drive-in stop for classic American comfort food with curb service since 1955. You need to order yourself a Super Boy.

posts.name: Smokey's BBQ Shack
posts.note: Smokey's BBQ Shack is a no-nonsense spot with platters and sandwiches of BBQ pulled pork, brisket, and more, along with Southern sides.

posts.name: Sweet n Savory Cafe
posts.note: Sweet n Savory Cafe has bright murals adorning this cheery cafe with all-day American eats, an on-site bakery, and outdoor seats. Order the deep-fried French Toast or the meatloaf sandwich with tomato jam and candied bacon.

posts.name: Toot-n-Tell
posts.note: Toot-n-Tell service is exceptional and the food tastes nothing less than homemade. Waitress are very attentive and made sure that all of our requests for performed properly.
